event: Here is the table of events and timestamps:
scheduled to undergo a left lobe hepatectomy
general anesthesia induced with propofol, rocuronium, and remifentanil
sevoflurane, remifentanil, and rocuronium for anesthesia maintenance
monitored by EKG, arterial blood pressure, central venous pressure, and SpO2
sudden decrease in arterial blood pressure, end-tidal carbon dioxide, and SpO2
tachycardia and ST elevation on EKG
massive air emboli in both left and right heart
pH 7.278, pCO2 51.3 mmHg, PO2 84.6 mmHg, HCO3- 24.2 mmHg, SaO2 94.4% on FiO2 0.5
systolic blood pressure and heart rate maintained at approximately 90 mmHg and 110 beats/min
end-tidal carbon dioxide restored to 32 mmHg
pH 7.338, pCO2 44.3 mmHg, PO2 234.0 mmHg, HCO3- 24.0 mmHg, SaO2 99.6% on FiO2 1.0
air emboli in left heart disappeared
systolic pressure maintained at approximately 90 mmHg
total urinary output and blood loss 220 ml and 800 ml, respectively
intubated and ventilated mechanically in ICU
systolic pressure maintained at approximately 90 mmHg
abnormal PT/PTT, fibrinogen, d-dimer, antithrombin III, CK-MB, and troponin-T
postoperative EKG showed ST elevation in II, III, and aVF
trans-thoracic echocardiogram showed unremarkable findings and no PFO
brain CT and MRI revealed multiple acute cerebral infarctions
weaned to Spontaneous ventilation with CPAP mode and extubated
panperitonitis confirmed by gram (+) cocci on peritoneal culture
expired due to cardiac arrest caused by septic shock
